results.title: Sydney today
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday, Jean Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Modern social studies”
Adapted from film of the same title originally produced for Textile Cones and Tubes Ltd. A travelogue of Sydney ranging from city streets to surfing beaches, centres of learning to expanding industries and homes to harbour activities.

results.title: Sydney Harbour Bridge. Bondi. Ayers Rock
results.brief_description: Paul Winkler is one of Australia’s leading experimental filmmakers. He’s continued making experimental films since the late sixties making many films that centre on and around Australian icons and Australian culture. Winkler explores these themes with a focus of analysis of the image itself. Deconstructing the icon, Winkler enables the viewer to catch a glimpse of the subject in its native form, unemcumbered by preconception. This video shows three of his films. Sydney Harbour Bridge (1977): a mesmerising film that frames the Sydney Harbour Bridge with it’s watery environment and surrounding reflections (playing homage perhaps to Maholy-Nagy 1951 film, Light Play Black, White, Grey). Bondi (1979): plays on a juxtaposition of cultural images and their context. The repositioning of the ‘Australian beach icons’ serves as a cultural positioning. In Bondi we see the filmmaker re-constructing our cultural landscape juxtaposing images in order that we may form some other sense of our culture. Ayers Rock (1981): explores one of Australia’s most famous icons. The image of the rock is deconstructed until it becomes a flat form of camoflague imposed on a panoramic view of the landscape.

results.title: Sydney Dance Company's Boxes
results.creator_credit: Sydney Dance Company and Geoff Nottage
results.brief_description: The Sydney Dance Company presents choreographer Graeme Murphy’s BOXES. Music composition by Iva Davies and Bob Kretschmer of “Icehouse”. “Boxes” has immediate visual appeal as a high-tech display of theatrical wizardry. It embraces all manner of popular dream images from contemporary mythology. Murphy moves his dancers through their strange rituals with endless imagination, probing at boxes - in minds, compartmentalised emotions and imprisoned spirits. Rating: G

results.title: Sydney : manufacturing decentralization
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Traces the four main phases in the location of manufacturing industry in the city of Sydney. Shows a pattern of deconcentration within the city

results.title: Switch on the night
results.creator_credit: Sarah Royds, Susan Cornish, Alejandra Canales and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A poetic documentary exploring stories of seven refugee children in Australia – their experiences of immigration, their memories, dreams and fears. All of them have experienced life in Australian immigration detention centres in Villawood, Baxter and Port Hedland but a large part of this reality remains unseen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sarah Royds, Susan Cornish, Alejandra Canales and AFTRS

results.title: Swiss ski symphony = Schweizer ski-symphonie
results.brief_description: Scenes of skiing of all kinds are carefully edited to synchronise with a symphonic piece played by a full orchestra. Photography by Josef Dahinden and music by Jean Daetwyler. No commentary.

results.title: Swiss on white: winter sports at St. Moritz
results.creator_credit: Phillip M. Brown and Central Films
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine style documentary on winter sports at St Moritz, Switzerland. Items include ice skating, ice hockey, horse racing on ice, trick skating, toboganning, skiing, snow marathon and ski jumping.

results.title: Swiss Family Robinson [Extracts]
results.brief_description:
While travelling aboard a 19th Century sailing vessel, the sophisticated Robinson family survive a devastating shipwreck and are forced to carve out a daring, primitive new life for themselves on a dangerous, deserted tropical island. Cast includes Dorothy McGuire, James MacArthur.
Extracts taken from the Walt Disney 1960 feature film production.

results.title: Swinging the broom
results.creator_credit: Andrew Wiseman, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Geoffrey Hall
results.brief_description: An elderly street sweeper, who has grown tired of his supposedly nagging wife, seeks relief from her by meeting the young woman he sees on his cleaning round. Ending up badly beaten, after his intentions have been misunderstood by one of the women, he arrives home to discover a caring wife. They make up and his misguided ways appear over. But are they?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew Wiseman, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Geoffrey Hall

results.title: Swing away
results.creator_credit: Castle Films, United World Films and Max Glandbard
results.brief_description: Golfer Tommy Armour demonstrates the importance of coordinated balance, rhythm, and timing in the backswing and the downswing. Shows the advantage of the closed stance for the drive and other long wood shots and of the square stance for long iron shots. Discusses the specific uses of various golf clubs. Includes demonstrations in slow motion photography.
